rpg.item

Class Armor

  • java.lang.Object
    • rpg.item.ItemImplementation
      • rpg.item.Armor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Item

    public class Armor
extends ItemImplementation
    A class of armors Armors are a special type of itemimplementation, involving aditionally a maximum value and a protection
    Author:
    Mathias, Frederic

    • Method Detail

      • canHaveAsId

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsId(long id)
        Checks whether this armor can have the given id as its id
        Specified by:
        canHaveAsId in interface Item
        Overrides:
        canHaveAsId in class ItemImplementation
        Parameters:
        id - The id to check.
        Returns:
        False if and only if there is a divisor of the id between 2 and the id minus one or if the id is less than or equal to 1. | result == ( for each integer in 2..(id-1): id%integer == 0 ) | || (id <= 1)
        See Also:
        formal specification of for loops

      • getMaxValue

        @Basic
@Raw
public int getMaxValue()
        Return the maximum value of this armor

      • isValidMaxValue

        public static boolean isValidMaxValue(int value)
        Check whether the given maximum value is valid
        Parameters:
        value - The value to check
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given maximum value is positive and less than or equal to 1000 | result == value>=0 && value<=1000

      • hasValidMaxValue

        @Raw
public boolean hasValidMaxValue()
        Checks whether the maximum value of this armor is valid.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the maximum value of this armor is a valid maximum value. | result == isValidMaxValue(getMaxValue())

      • getValue

        public int getValue()
        Return the value of this armor
        Specified by:
        getValue in interface Item
        Overrides:
        getValue in class ItemImplementation
        Returns:
        The result is the product of the maximum value of this armor and the quotient of the maximum protection factor and the actual protection factor | result == getMaxValue() * (getProtection()/getMaxProtection())
        See Also:
        Item

      • getMaxProtection

        @Basic
@Raw
public int getMaxProtection()
        Return the maximum protection factor of this armor

      • isValidMaxProtection

        @Raw
public static boolean isValidMaxProtection(int maxProtection)
        Check whether the given maximum protection is valid
        Parameters:
        maxProtection - The maximum protection to check
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given maximum protection is greater than or equal to 1 and less than or equal to 100 | result == value>=1 && value<=100

      • hasValidMaxProtection

        @Raw
public boolean hasValidMaxProtection()
        Checks whether the maximum protection of this armor is valid.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the maximum protection of this armor is a valid maximum protection. | result == isValidMaxProtection(getMaxProtection())

      • canHaveAsProtection

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsProtection(int protection)
        Check whether this armor can have the given protection as its protection
        Parameters:
        protection - The protection to check
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given protection is positive and less than or equal to the maximum protection | result == ( ( protection >= 0) && (protection <= getMaxProtection() ) )

      • hasValidProtection

        @Raw
public boolean hasValidProtection()
        Check whether this armor can has a valid protection
        Returns:
